reviews.sentence: Great stay. Checked in early in the morning after an overnight flight. Was immediately checked into a room and was upgraded by the front desk to a huge suite. The kindness this hotel showed us by doing this made our stay above and beyond.

60th birthday. A nice hotel centrally situated for the major attractions The room was ok with complementary tea and cofeThe people on the desk were very good nothing seemed to be a Problem to themthere was free wine from 5 to 6 every night which was greatBefore going out for dinner I would recommend this hotel when your goingTo have a taste of the big apple.

Very nice and comfortable. we have stayed at a number of places in New York and the Afinia Shelburne was a good combination of comfortable contemporary and quiet. The rooms were nice size including the bathrooms. The restaurant in the hotel is good for all three meals and evening drinks snacks. The location is a little distance from the theatre district but easily walkable to Grand Central Station and many good restaurants. The staff was accommodating though less generously service oriented than most other hotels The Pearl City Club and others in which we have stayed.

Nice new find. Stayed here last night and will definitely be back. Great location near the 6 train and Grand Central. Nicely decorated super clean room. Comfortable bed. Staff is very nice especially the cleaning staff. They do a great job of making the hotel shine and could not be friendlier. We got a great rate through hotelscom and were given a beautiful corner room with great light and a view of the East River. My only complaint is that they should be giving a free wifi password to every guest. They said something about signing up for it and agreeing to terms and then they would reverse the charge. Unnecessarily complicated. Other than that this place is a gem. Very happy to give them two thumbs up.

Good place to stay near the heart of Manhattan. Our stay at Shelburne was very pleasant and the location was great. The staff was nice and helpful. The RareBare restaurant had some excellent burgers. The room top bar was already great. Only thing missing was a closet with a bit more shelves. I hate living out of my luggage and prefer to take everything out and put it up. I would have giving the hotel a 5 if the wifi was free though it was complementary in my case. In 2016 hotel room wifi should be free of charge.
Convenient hotel and very friendly staff. Excellent staff who were engaging and helpful. Like the wine evening.
Had a wonderful 2 night stay. Hotel and staff were more than we could ask for.
Excellent Staff. Excellent hotel well located efficient and very personable staff.

Excellent but watch out for snack bar charges. Very good service and hotel. Room a little smal typical of NY. Also I spent 50 100 dat on snack bar items. Watch out. everything is 10. Bottle of water 10. Etc. Comfortablefe Great location. Very convenient. Free water.
Nice and central friendly and affordable hotel. Stayed for 5 nights in August. Room was clean and comfortable staff friendly and helpful. Meals in restaurant excellent with good service.

do not get why this gets a high rating. Noisy housekeeping staff in the mornings able to hear conversations in corridor and elevator next to room. Mold on bathroom tiles abrupt receptionist Renata who took away one of the Expedia VIP promises in one dismissive and rude sentence elusive doorman smoking swearing and on their mobile devices. no thank you I will not be staying at this hotel again. Just leaves that frustrated feeling of bad and rude service in a so called 4 star New York Hotel.

One of the bellmen when we arrived was strangely short with us. The first room we were given smelled like smoke. It smelled very differently than the hallways and he lonbybwhixh smelled fine. He told me that he did n’t smell anything and that it did n’t smell like smoke. Then he said with irritation “ well what do you want me to do with your luggage. I ca n’t leave it here in the hallway ”. Strange. We asked to go back to the lobby. No big deal. And explain that the room smelled like smoke and ask for a different one. The people at the front desk were all great. Very friendly and understanding. But that bellman was one of our first introductions to the hotel and was so unpleasant.

Still my favorite in NYC but with some negatives this time. I am a returning guest at this Hotel and come back a few times a year. I always enjoy the easy going atmosphere it is not a fancy place but I feel at home and most of all I enjoy the silence at night which actually allows me to get a good night slepRom was spacious this time it is not always so and the bed extremely comfy. I had asked for a room at the back of the building as usual since those are the quite ones for the first night they gave me an extremely noisy one on a low floor and on the street so I could not close an eye during the whole night. They changed my room the next day however and for 3 nights I had the quitest room ever. Prices are increasing everytime with all the extras you have to pay not just taxes but also minibar and wifi which are not free but you are basically forced to pay use them and what was a great value for money it is no longer really so. And the rooms doors hairdryers bathrooms would need some improvement. The staff at the reception on check in and check out for the first time in years was not friendly at all. I had booked through Bokingcom and by mistake the hotel had charged all the amount in advance while it was not a reservation with advance payment when I asked for explanations they were not really helpful and nobody told me SORRY. We made a mistake ancd charged you the amount 1 month in advance. Here is a free drink for you or whatever. So I still like this place and will be back but I hope to go back to the friendly welcoming Hotel I used to know.
Poor. Every single staff member was rude and miserable. I was charged 3 times for almost 200.

Thankfully the staff gave us a different room after the first night. The noise from Lex was just too much. The windows are just too damn cheap. The dirt on the windows does not serve as a sound barrier. I have stayed in places where massive church bells start at 515am and triple glazing does the trick.

Overall good value and worth the experience. Overall I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed the stay. The room was sizeable if dated and the air con unit was big and noisy bit what is n’t in NY. Generally the staff was helpful and nice. My review would be higher but for one staff member who clearly had something out for me. Not a big issue but I had a suit bag and on my day of departure I left it with the front desk with other bags. Later in the day when I checked on it to change i saw it was intentionally left crumbled under my suitcase. Not impressed with this one clearly classless and rude act by one employee.

Good hotel but poor service. Large roomed good value hotel in midtown. The hotel was fine room was comfortable and had all amenities required. I think you should always have at least one free bottle of water in a room which you do n’t get but that ’s a small issue and not going to lose sleep over it. My main issue was the service I just did n’t find it to be a friendly hotel. When I was really ill and had to book an extra night because I could n’t leave my room for sickness I could n’t even get a bottle of water brought to the room and was made to come downstairs despite my illness to sign for the extra night and to pick up a bottle of water. I just found this to be poor service and a little disappointing. Overall though this hotel is fine for a business trip.

dirty. A dirty sock found in the room right on the chair where the desk is. The out door terrace was closed days including the day I stayed. That was the main reason I picked this hotel. This is a residential neighborhood so if you are in the mood for a good bite or drink you actually have to walk there or battle traffic.

Business. The hotel was located is a nice area however their front desk employees are ABSOLUTELY RUDE. I would not EVER recommend this hotel due to poor service as I wait on hold for someone to hang up for a 3rd time. Lack of professionalism and attention to the client experience.

WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY TO EXPLORE NYC. please lose the high Facility Fee the 10 food drink credit. only worth one vitamin water each day. We loved our room partitioned kitchen with ice maker in larger than regular ho2 nice window shades. one for privacy and one room darkening. clean room and hall and lobby pleasant staff. we used room service every day. such good food.
